results.7-7: Weapon with a total of (3) enchantments
results.8-8: Armor with a total of (3) enchantments
results.9-9: Shield with a total of (3) enchantments
results.12-12: Roll again, the item is made of a special material

results.5-5: Potion of Major Relief and Restoration
results.9-9: Potion of Minor Relief and Restoration
results.11-11: Potion of Minor Speed and Quickness
results.19-19: Potion of Minor Healing and Neutralize Poison or Disease

results.8-8: Staff of Abjuration, Evocation, or Necromancy

results.1-1:
Grey Bag: Bat

Brown Bag: Dog/ Wolf
results.3-3:
Grey Bag: Bird of Prey

Brown Bag: Cat, large
results.4-4:
Grey Bag: Cat, small

Brown Bag: Auroch
results.5-5:
Grey Bag: Snake, Constrictor

Brown Bag: Bear
results.6-6:
Grey Bag: Dog/ Wolf

Brown Bag: Rhinoceros

results.2-2: Inspire: The warrior battles valiantly, inspiring the troops and urging them to fight on despite their injuries. Her side immediately recovers one Force Token.
results.3-4: Terrorize: The fighter’s fury terrorizes her foes. The enemy commander subtracts 2 from his @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} roll if forced to test morale this round.
results.5-9: Valor: The warrior’s Support adds +2 to the commander’s Battle roll as usual.
results.10-11: Slaughter: The foe reels at the champion’s onslaught. Subtract 2 from the enemy commander’s Battle total.
results.12-12: An Army of One: Tales will be told and songs sung of the warrior’s epic feats this day. The enemy army loses a Force Token immediately (this doesn’t subtract from his Battle roll but does cause a morale check even if he wins).

Creative Combat.name: Creative Combat
Creative Combat.description: Use these rules when you want Tests to have a little more variety.

results.2-2: Second Wind: The foe hesitates, giving your hero time to catch her breath. She may remove a level of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Fatigue} or a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wound} (her choice). If she has neither, the enemy is @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken} and she receives a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Benny}.
results.3-3: Inspiration: Fate favors the bold. The clever hero receives a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Benny}.
results.4-5: Double Whammy: The target is both @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Distracted and Vulnerable}.
results.9-10: Setback: The target suffers a setback of some sort. She might fall off a ledge, lose the confidence of her minions (who then desert her), take a rash but foolish action, or simply lose her next turn as she attempts to recover from whatever situation she finds herself in.
results.11-11: Insight: The hero gains insight into the target’s nature. Once during this encounter, she may add +d6 to any @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Trait} roll made to directly @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{attack}, affect, or @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{damage} the same foe.
results.12-12: Seize the Moment: After the hero resolves this turn, she immediately gets an entire additional turn. This includes @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{movement} as well! She may use the turn to go on @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Hold} if she wishes.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description: *Add the creature’s Fear penalty as a positive number to this roll.

results.1-3: Adrenaline Surge: The hero’s "fight" response takes over. He acts as if he had a Joker this action!
results.4-6: Distracted: The hero is @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Distracted} until the end of his next turn.
results.7-9: Vulnerable: The target is @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Vulnerable} until the end of his next turn.
results.13-13: The Mark of Fear: The hero is @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Stunned} and suffers some cosmetic physical alteration — a white streak forms in his hair, his eyes twitch constantly, or some other minor physical alteration manifests.
results.14-15: Frightened: The character gains the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-hindrances.Hesitant]{Hesitant} Hindrance for the remainder of the encounter. If he already has it, he’s Panicked instead.
results.16-17: Panicked: The character immediately moves his full @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Pace} plus running die away from the danger and is @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken}.
results.18-19: Minor Phobia: The character gains a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-hindrances.Phobia]{Minor Phobia} Hindrance somehow associated with the trauma.
results.20-21: Major Phobia: The character gains the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-hindrances.Phobia]{Major Phobia} Hindrance.
results.22-9999: Heart Attack: The hero is so overwhelmed with fear that his heart stutters. He must make an immediate @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Vigor} roll at –2. If successful, he’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Stunned}. If he fails, he’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitated} and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Death]{dies} in 2d6 rounds. In the latter case, a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Healing]{Healing} roll at –4 saves his life, but he remains Incapacitated. He may be treated normally thereafter.

results.1-2: Broken Guts: Agility reduced a die type (minimum d4).
results.3-4: Battered Guts: Vigor reduced a die type (minimum d4).
results.5-6: Busted Guts: Strength reduced a die type (minimum d4).

results.1-3: Hideous Scar: Your hero now has the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-hindrances.Ugly]{Ugly} (Major) Hindrance.
results.4-5: Blinded: An eye is damaged. Gain the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-hindrances.One Eye]{One Eye} Hindrance (or the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-hindrances.Blind]{Blind} Hindrance if he only had one good eye).
results.6-6: Brain Damage: Massive trauma to the head. Smarts reduced one die type (min d4).

Injury.name: Injury
Injury.description: When Incapacitated by damage or injury, a hero must make an immediate Vigor roll. If the character does not die as a result, they must roll on the Injury Table.

results.2-2: Unmentionables: If the injury is permanent, reproduction is out of the question without miracle surgery or magic. There is no other effect from this result.
results.3-4: Arm: The victim can no longer use his left or right arm (rolled randomly if not targeted).
results.10-11: Leg: Gain the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-hindrances.Slow]{Slow} Hindrance (Minor), or Major if already Slow or injured in either leg.

Reaction.name: Reaction
Reaction.description: The GM can use the table below to roll or choose a character or group's initial attitude

results.2-2: Hostile: The target is openly hostile. He may attack if possible, or otherwise betray, report on, or hinder the party at the first opportunity. He doesn’t help without an overwhelming reward or threat of some kind.
results.3-3: Unfriendly: The character isn’t interested in helping unless he has little choice and/or is offered a substantial payment or reward.
results.4-5: Uncooperative: The target isn’t interested in getting involved unless there’s a significant advantage to himself.
results.6-8: Neutral: The character has no particular attitude toward the group. He expects fair payment for any sort of favor or information.
results.9-10: Cooperative: The character is generally sympathetic. He helps if he can for a small fee, favor, or kindness.
results.11-11: Friendly: The individual goes out of his way for the hero. He likely does simple tasks for very little, and is willing to do more dangerous tasks for fair pay or other favors.
results.12-12: Helpful: The target is anxious to help the hero and probably does so for little or no reward.

Robe of Useful Items.name: Robe of Useful Items
Robe of Useful Items.description: The Robe has several other patches. Roll 4d4 for the number of other patches and then roll d12 for each on the table below to determine its nature.

results.2-2: Door, iron (up to 10 ft. wide and 10 ft. high and barred on one side—must be placed upright, attaches and hinges itself)
results.6-6: Pit, open (12 ft. by 12 ft. by 12 ft.)
results.7-7: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Potion of Major Healing]{Potion of major healing}
results.9-9: Minor scroll of one randomly determined spell
results.11-11: Window (2 ft. by 4 ft., up to 2 ft. deep)

Rod of Wonder Activation.name: Rod of Wonder Activation
Rod of Wonder Activation.description: A Rod of Wonder is a strange and unpredictable device that randomly generates any number of weird effects each time it is used. Typical powers of the rod are listed on the Rod of Wonder Activation table below. Unless noted otherwise, the Duration for any of the effects is 5.

results.3-3: 600 butterflies pour forth and flutter around for two rounds, blinding everyone within 5” (10 yards).
results.4-4: The rod deludes the wielder for one round into believing it functions as indicated by a second die roll.
results.5-5: The wielder’s Size is reduced by two for one day.
results.6-6: Heavy rain falls for 1 round in 10” (20 yard) radius, centered on the wielder.
results.7-7: The wielder gains major @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Invisibility]{invisibility}. The effect vanishes if he takes an action that causes damage to others.
results.8-8: Leaves grow from the target’s limbs, lasting 24 hours.
results.9-9: The wielder or a random target turns blue, green, or purple. Permanently.
results.10-10: A magical explosion detonates in a Small Blast Template for 3d6 damage, centered on whatever the user targeted.
results.11-11: Grass grows in 160-square-ft. area centered on the target of the rod. Foliage that already existed in the area grows to 10 times normal size.
results.12-12: A patch of @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Light / Darkness]{darkness} in a Large Blast Template appears over the target.
results.13-13: The wielder learns the target’s surface thoughts (as with @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Mind Reading]{mind reading}) for 1d4 rounds. This can’t be resisted.
results.14-14: Dancing lights surround the target, negating any @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Illumination} penalties.
results.17-17: The rod summons forth a wild animal. Roll 1d6: 1–2 bear, 3–4 lion, 5–6 cat (or any other animal of the GM's choice, including those in the Savage Pathfinder Bestiary).
results.18-18: Shimmering colors dance and play over a 40-ft square area directly in front of the rod. Any creature within is blinded. Those affected get a free action to shake off the effects with a Vigor roll at –2 at the start of their turn.
results.19-19: 1d4x10 gems (1 gp each) shoot forward in a stream. Half hit the target, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Distracting} him.
results.20-20: The target turns to stone (or flesh if stone already), unless it makes a Vigor roll at –2.
